s.text: Both pulse sequences used a time-to-echo of 8.5ms, section thicknesses of 0.5mm, in-plane resolutions of 100?m, and two averages, for a total imaging time of less than 1 hour per sample.
MATLAB (The Math Works, Natick, MA, USA) was used to create a T1 map by curve-fitting each T1-weighted image series on a voxel-by-voxel basis.

Following IL-1 exposure, the samples were transferred to sterile flat-bottomed 10mm nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) tubes (Wilbur Scientific, Boston, MA, USA) that were custom cut to a length of 5cm, where they were cultured in basal media for the duration of the recovery experiment.
